contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=April 2011}} {{Infobox First Lady | name = Eva Köhler | image = Eva Köhler - Juni 2009.jpg | caption = | imagesize = | birthname = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1947|01|2|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Ludwigsburg]], [[Allied-occupied Germany]] | order = [[List of spouses of German presidents and chancellors|First Lady of Germany]] | president = [[Horst Köhler]] | term_start = 1 July 2004 | term_end = 31 May 2010 | predecessor = [[Christina Rau]] | successor = [[Bettina Wulff]] | religion = | profession = German teacher | spouse = [[Horst Köhler]] | children = Ulrike Köhler,<br /> Jochen Köhler | signature = }} '''Eva Luise Köhler''' ({{IPA-de|ˈkøːlɐ|lang|De-Eva Luise Köhler.ogg}}; born 2 January 1947 in [[Ludwigsburg]] as '''Eva Luise Bohnet''') is the wife of the former [[Germany|German]] [[President of Germany|President]] [[Horst Köhler]] and as such, was sometimes referred to by the [[mass media|media]] as the "[[List of spouses of German presidents and chancellors|First Lady]]" during her husband's presidency, from [[2004]] to [[2010]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.rhein-zeitung.de/startseite_artikel,-Ex-First-Lady-Eva-Koehler-im-Interview-%E2%80%9EMenschen-mit-seltenen-Erkrankungen-fallen-durchs-soziale-Net-_arid,210684.html|title=Ex-First-Lady Eva Köhler im Interview: „Menschen mit seltenen Erkrankungen fallen durchs soziale Netz“|date=27 February 2011|work=[[Rhein-Zeitung]]|language=German|accessdate=21 April 2011}}</ref> She completed her ''[[Abitur]]'' in [[Ludwigsburg]] in 1966, and studied History, [[Germanistics]] and Religion. She then became a teacher of [[German language|German]]. Eva Köhler was a member of the [[Social Democratic Party of Germany|Social Democratic Party]] (SPD) from 1972 to 1990 (as she advocated [[Willy Brandt|Willy Brandt's]] [[Ostpolitik]]) and participated in local politics. She left the SPD because she disliked the politics of [[Oskar Lafontaine]]. Eva and Horst Köhler have two children, Ulrike (born 1972) and Jochen (born 1977). == Honours == === Foreign honours === * {{Flag|Lithuania}} : Grand Cross of the [[Order of Vytautas the Great]] (19 October 2005) <ref>Lituanian Presidency Website, [http://www.lrp.lt/lt/prezidento_veikla/apdovanojimai/apdovanojimai_256/p40.html Search form]</ref> * {{Flag|Netherlands}} : Grand Cross of the [[Order of the Crown (Netherlands)|Order of the Crown]] (2007)<ref>[http://www.gotha.fr/3.aspx?page=6&sr=271 Gotha.fr], State visit of Germany to the Netherlands, 2007, [http://www.gotha.fr/Photos/dsc%28010%29.jpg Photo]</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-hon}} {{s-bef|before=[[Christina Rau]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[List of spouses of German presidents and chancellors|First Lady of Germany]]|years=2004-2010}} {{s-aft|after=[[Bettina Wulff]]}} {{End}} {{Authority control|VIAF=171282088}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Kohler, Eva | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =2 January 1947 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Ludwigsburg]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kohler, Eva}} [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:German educators]] [[Category:Spouses of the Presidents of Germany]] <!-- Honours --> [[Category:Grand Crosses of the Order of the Crown (Netherlands)]] [[Category:Grand Crosses of the Order of Vytautas the Great]]
